abstract: German pro-immigration groups and activists organize demonstrations in order to counter anti-immigration rallies held by group Pegida; despite their attempt, tens of thousands of demonstrators turn out in Dresden in support of Pegida, which some officials have accused of trying to exploit terrorist attack in Paris.
lead_paragraph: Rallies called by anti-immigration forces have led their political opponents in cities like Dresden and Leipzig to organize counterdemonstrations.

byline.contributor: Erik Olsen contributed reporting from Dresden, Germany.

snippet: Rallies called by anti-immigration forces have led their political opponents in cities like Dresden and Leipzig to organize counterdemonstrations.

headline.main: Big Anti-Immigration Rally in Germany Prompts Counterdemonstrations
headline.print_headline: Big Anti-Immigration Rally in Germany Prompts Counterdemonstrations
